metadata.synopsis: A sky diver (Charlie Sheen) lands in the middle of a deadly spy caper with his student (Nastassja Kinski), who is not what she appears to be.

reviews: Although the realism is at a staggering low, the screenplay is surprisingly clever, using quite a few jokes and suspenseful situations for impressive comedic effect.
...a perfectly watchable (if entirely forgettable) little thriller...
As a wise-cracking sky-diving instructor, Charlie Sheen wears his usual look of someone who has just been asked a really difficult question (like: how come your career has lasted this long?).

A brisk, sleek wrong-man story that's easily the better of 1994's dueling skydiver movies and, had a darker Charlie Sheen from another universe not swapped places with our own, might have made the actor Kurt Russell's action-movie heir apparent.
Some of the comic writing undercuts the preposterous story.

A formula thriller with a skydiving theme, there is not a single plot turn that can hold up under close examination, but if you let the movie breeze by, untethered by common sense or logic, it can be an enjoyable experience.
An absolute piece of terminal trash.
Not exciting enough to be a Die Hard, not funny enough to be a Hot Shots! film either.
Fun action movie if you forgive the total silliness.
